name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Nice

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for about a week when doing some business in Nice and as it was low seasons, hotel offered me complimentary upgrade to a sea-view room which was nice. check-in was a bit problematic as my room was not cleaned upon arrival at 3, so they tried to put me back in a city-view room, even though occupancy was very low as it turned out later.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for business trip

reviews.text: Room was decorated nicely, had a spacious balcony which is very noisy though - 6 traffic lanes directy in front of the building. Also bathroom in excellent condition, very clean.
reviews.title: Surface good but attention to detail failed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very rich, although always the same, can be boring after a while, but hey, which hotel is different! :)
reviews.title: Great View and Very convenient of you have a car

likes.disliked: — the high prices due to the bad dollar

reviews.text: Only problem was with the staff attitude, not friendly, helpful at all, they really did not look like trying to solve issues (e.g. wifi is free but signal is very bad, some days i was unable to use it, or needed info on bus schedules and they could not find it out - later on i found everything on the website of Nice town...)
reviews.title: Beautiful location, beautiful rooms, beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Location is only good for business travellers as the hotel is really close to the airport, but far away from city center!
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of a first-class bus tour of France. The hotel is right on the Promenade des Anglais (the waterfront avenue), facing right onto the beach and water. However, it is located considerably to the west of where the action is in Nice (by action is meant restaurants, shopping, bars, etc.). Although the hotel attempts to overcome its geographical disadvantage by running a shuttle into the heart of Nice, the hours of operation are quite limited, especially into the evenings. Our hotel room was spacious, clean, modern with every reasonable convenience. The staff were all friendly and very helpful, going out of their way to make one feel welcome. The buffet breakfast is really excellent. To overcome the hotel's location disadvantage, we simply took a taxi back to the hotel in the evening when we had exhausted Nice's active area (about 15 Euro's, which is not huge in the overall scheme of things of staying in Nice).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel right on waterfront, somewhat away from action

likes.liked: — Location, right on the waterfront. Great buffet breakfasts.
likes.disliked: — Location, somewhat distant from the heart of Nice's action

reviews.text: Hotel facilties were very good and staff helpful. Rooms are very up to date with large LCD TV and rooms facing the sea have good balconies. Despite warning from others we were never charged to use the pool and sun loungers. Roof top bar has excellent views as does the restaurant although we only took breakfast in the hotel. The beach is only a stones throw across the road and the airport is close (but not too close!) by. Otherwise the location is far from ideal. Its at least 30 minutes walk to reach the town centre, longer to the old town, but a pleasant walk. Took a taxi one night which cost 12 euros. Parking in the basement car park is pricey at around 20 euros a night but there are residential streets a couple of blocks back from the beach were you can park for free. After paying for the first night we parked on the street for the next 3 nights with no problem. Breakfast was very good and served until 10.30 every day.
reviews.title: Good hotel, poor location
My trip in Nice
reviews.text: I stayed there for 5 night. The room is great. The problem is it's a littel bit far from the city center. It's has the bus stop in front of the hotel but at night you'll walk 10-15 mins from the nearest bus station to the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned home from trip to Nice, south of France where we stayed in Radisson SAS. The hotel is only 10 mins from airport but is at the complete opposite end of promenade from where all Retaurants, Cafe's, Bars and markets and all other attractions are.
reviews.title: Service and Staff Great But..........

reviews.text: It is about 40 min walk to lively end of promenade but if you are heading out for night on town you dont want to have to treck in your best gear to the other end of town in the heat!!!
reviews.title: Very nice, but very expensive

reviews.text: A nice hotel but stayed in more impressive 4* hotels with bigger rooms.
reviews.title: nice hotel but uncomfortable with extras

likes.liked: — most of staff friendly and helpful with one exception

reviews.text: We were a bit worried about previous reviews before our trip. My husband and I and our 15 yr old son spent 1 week here. We had been concerned about the 20 euros a day breakfast as previous comments say there are no restaurants nearby and whilst I enjoy spending money on good food £45 a day for breakfast was going to hurt. However if you go behind the hotel there are a few basic cafes to the left or right that serve omelettes, croissants, paninis etc and a decent coffee. There are also some lovely patisserie shops especially next to spar. We found some other hotel guests stocking up there.
reviews.title: Great hotel -perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool sunbeds are very expensive at 17 euros a day. Yes I know this is the south of France but we spent some time in Italy where they charge but don't rob you. The beach is an option but its very rocky and sunbeds still 17 euros.
reviews.title: LOVELY HOTEL BUT WITH SOME NEGATIVES

reviews.text: The location isnt great but my husband didnt mind, he thought it was a good way of walking off the delicious meals we enjoyed in town. You can get a bus at the back of hotel which takes you into the centre but the hotel porter told us its probably better to walk or get taxi at night as late buses tend to go all over Nice (ladies make sure your stilletos will withstand the trek or take flatties in a bag for going home, I have blisters on my blisters)
reviews.title: Extra fee for everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly, my only downside was a query on our mini bar bill on the first night, We had been charged 6.50 euros for candy/bonbons and when I explained to the night receptionist that the only candy we ate was a box next to the bottle of water with complimentary slip on a table 6ft away from the mini bar she shrugged and said I would have to pay. I stood my ground and advised this was not on and eventually she gave in. The next day it was still on and I spoke to the day receptionist who couldnt have been nicer, she laughed and removed the item and also removed peanuts from bill as we hadnt had them either.
reviews.title: Nice but a long walk

likes.liked: — It was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful
likes.disliked: — I need to repair the soles of my shoes

reviews.title: Disappointing
Absolute Bollocks.
